statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: A.J. Mosby, Reginal Johnson and Avery Patterson each scored 14 points to lead Alcorn State to a 93-48 win against Selma on Friday night.
article.headline: Braves trio leads Alcorn State past Selma 93-48
article.linkText: Braves trio leads Alcorn State past Selma 93-48
article.story: LORMAN, Miss. -- A.J. Mosby, Reginal Johnson and Avery Patterson each scored 14 points to lead Alcorn State to a 93-48 win against Selma on Friday night. Maurice Howard scored 12 points and Yalen Reed and Marquis Vance each added 11. Vance, a senior, needs five points to reach 1,000 for his career. Alcorn State has won six straight home openers. The Braves scored the game's first 13 points before Selma cut into the lead and trailed 25-16. Alcorn State then pulled away, and a tip-in by Johnson off a lob at the halftime buzzer made the score 42-22. Reed got Alcorn State's crowd off its feet early in the second half with a thunderous dunk over a Selma defender. The Braves controlled the interior, outscoring Selma 42-20, and had a 64-37 rebounding advantage. Devante Brown led Selma with 17 points. Selma is a Division I-member of the NCCAA and lists an enrollment of 600 students.
